availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. Coleman (Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and militiaman - 1st Lieut. State Guard)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of Henry Coleman and Frances Coleman. Married to Piety Jones Coleman in Montgomery County, Tennessee, on November 27, 1860. Father of Caroline Coleman, Ella Coleman, Susan Coleman, and Margarette Coleman. Resident of Montgomery County, Tennessee, in 1850. Served in the Kentucky State Guard as a 1st Lieutenant in 1860. Farmer in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Montgomery County, Districts 1-4, p. 255B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Boswell's Precinct p. 15A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Graves County, KY, July 1863, p. 12.
"James B. Coleman (1834-1918)," Find A Grave, Memorial 13560198, accessed January 2, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13560198.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, X County, 1838 - 1874: Marriages 3, p. 103.
